entry.title: Saving Grace Humane Society Announces 17 Seized Dogs Now Available for Adoption
entry.summary: Saving Grace Humane Society announced that 17 dogs seized in August of 2025 with assistance from Roseburg police and Douglas County Animal Control are now available for adoption. The dogs spent several months receiving medical care and socialization and are ready for placement.

entry.title: Roseburg Mayor to Deliver 2026 State of the City Address Jan. 12
entry.summary: Roseburg Mayor Larry Rich will deliver the city’s 2026 State of the City address at 7 p.m. Monday, Jan. 12, during the first City Council meeting of the year at City Hall. The presentation will also be streamed live online.

entry.title: Winston Man Arrested After Attempted Elude Early Thursday Morning
entry.summary: A Winston man was arrested early Thursday after allegedly attempting to elude police during a traffic stop. Officers pursued the vehicle from Main Street and Brosi Orchard Road to Highway 42 and Brockway Road before taking the driver into custody.

entry.title: Two-Day Ham Radio General License Class Scheduled in Glide
entry.summary: A two-day Amateur Radio General License class will be held Feb. 14–15, 2026, at the Glide Fire Station. The General license is the second FCC license level and requires a current Technician license to upgrade.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01.09.26
entry.summary: Superintendent Terry Prestianni with a mid-year update on what’s happening in the Sutherlin School District.

entry.title: Commissioners Approve Drug Enforcement Grant for Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team
entry.summary: Douglas County commissioners approved a renewed $1.9 million state grant to support the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team through August 2027. The funding will support investigations and enforcement related to illegal marijuana operations, according to county officials.

entry.title: Police Log: January 8, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations Jan. 8, including a robbery investigation, a downtown exclusion zone trespass, and a drinking in public violation. Several individuals were lodged at Douglas County Corrections, according to police logs.

entry.summary: I read 153 books last year. Not a record, but I was pleased with the quality of the titles I chose.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 1.9.26
entry.summary: Joey Keeran has a preview of the Peach Bowl featuring the Oregon Ducks and the Indiana Hoosiers. Hear it Friday on KQEN with pre-game beginning at 2:30 p.m.

entry.title: Roseburg Parks and Recreation to Launch Discover Roseburg 15 Geocache Series Feb. 7
entry.summary: Roseburg Parks and Recreation will launch the Discover Roseburg 15 Land of Umpqua Geocache Series with a free public kickoff Saturday, Feb. 7, from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. at the Roseburg Public Library. The challenge includes 20 geocache locations across the city.

entry.title: Building, evolving and serving: Con-Vey celebrates 80 years of business
entry.summary: Con-Vey may have started as a fabrication and machine shop focused on repair work for local mills, but 80 years later it is a full-service industrial automation provider nationally recognized for its contributions to the manufacturing industry.

entry.title: Safe Routes for School grant applications open soon
entry.summary: Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT) announced that Safe Routes to School grant applications will open in February 2026.

entry.title: Douglas County population estimates decrease as Oregon gains residents
entry.summary: Research shows approximately 17,000 new residents flocked to Oregon over the past year, but it also shows that they did not come to Douglas County.

entry.title: ODFW Opens Paid Wildlife Student Internships for Summer & Fall 2026
entry.summary: ODFW is accepting applications for paid Wildlife Student Internships for summer and fall 2026. College students can gain hands-on field experience in wildlife management, habitat restoration, and research across Oregon. Applications close Jan. 20, 2026.

entry.title: Diamond Lake Resort Opens Tubing Hill After 12 Inches of Fresh Snow
entry.summary: Diamond Lake Resort received 12 inches of snow in the past 24 hours, bringing the base to 23 inches at 5,200 feet. The tubing hill opens for night tubing at 6 p.m. tomorrow (01/09), with snowmobile trails also being groomed as winter recreation ramps up.

entry.title: Jon Martz is Oregon's high school principal of 2026

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested Following Burglary at Vacant SE Pine Street Home
entry.summary: A Roseburg man was arrested after police responded to a reported burglary at a vacant SE Pine Street home. Officers found extensive interior damage exceeding $1,000. The suspect was later located nearby and faces burglary and criminal mischief charges.

entry.title: Mercy Medical Center among Oregon hospitals anticipating upcoming strains

entry.title: Road to Umpqua Hot Springs Closed Due to Winter Storm
entry.summary: Starting Jan. 6, 2026, NFSR 3401, the road to Umpqua Hot Springs, will close due to a winter storm. Vehicles must park at the gate. Visitors must hike, snowshoe, or ski the final 2.5 miles.

entry.title: UCAN HONORING 20 YEAR PARTNERSHIP WITH SHERM’S THUNDERBIRD
entry.summary: January 7, 2026 3:05 a.m. The United Community Action Network is honoring its 20-year partnership with Sherm’s Thunderbird Market and the help that it has been providing to assist the work of its regional food bank. A UCAN release said on January 15th Sherm’s will re-affirm its long-standing commitment to fighting hunger by donating a...

entry.title: FOOD AS MEDICINE OREGON HOLDING LIFESTYLE AND NUTRITIION COURSE
entry.summary: January 7, 2026 2:50 a.m. Food as Medicine Oregon has its Lifestyle and Nutrition Course beginning on Tuesday, January 13th. Registration is open for this hybrid course. Participants can attend in person at the Aviva Health conference room in Roseburg, virtually over Zoom, or at public satellite locations in Grants Pass, Canyonville and Bandon. The...

entry.title: Showers for the Valley, Heavy Mountain Snow
entry.summary: Expect some fairly low snow levels Wednesday and Thursday mornings down to as low as 2,500-feet, but the heaviest in the Cascades for up to 24" of new snow by Thursday morning.

entry.title: Canyonville, Myrtle Creek applicants welcome for South Umpqua School District Board of Education
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — South Umpqua School District is looking for applicants to fill two vacant positions on the board of education.

entry.title: UCC hosts 'Transuranic,' a radioactive photography exhibit
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — At first glance, the scenes presented in Abbey Hepner’s photography seem fairly mundane: A lone sign and barbed wire fence in the middle of a grassy field, or pale corporate buildings sitting on the horizon across a plain.

entry.title: Roseburg Public Library hosts Chess Club
entry.summary: Randi Janeksela and her son Markus Janeksela played a few matches of chess to warm up at the Roseburg Public Library’s Chess Club on Saturday.
